text:
Hi people!
Did anyone knows why HubSpot could say that an hutk is invalid? Example:
`Error in 'context.hutk'. 'amp-tstsU9IU_XXXXXXXXXXXX' is not a valid Hutk Request failed with status code 400`
From this endpoint:
<https://api.hsforms.com/submissions/v3/integration/secure/submit/>
When I am submitting my form I want that email to show up on my thanks page how can I achieve that?? :pray:
the hutk in your example surely doesn't look like a valid hutk, make sure you're actually passing the value you get from the cookie and not a random value
That's wrong?
That should work
Then, who could generate a wrong hutk in cookie?

this could probably do the trick:

the calc property is the "combined revenue"

the "gibt es den kontakt schon" is your Status and at the "Ja" you put the raw value of the status you would want to check -> so the Full-Time Part time part

then depending on the status the value of the "fp-id"=Monthly Pay or the "Average Pageviews"=Total Hourly Pay is choosen.

You would still need 2 calculation properties to map both statuses Full time + Part time
i tried to fit 2 status in one couldn't do it should be very easy bc you just have to check after "Ja" with an or and then put the other value there but or just wants a boolean so yea

<@UQNEXHW14> I think I might have stumbled on something here:

I googled something and clicked a link to the forums. In the url a profile language parameter is set. Either it is the profile language of the post author or the forums that just assigns my anonymous visit a random language (was not logged in)?

<https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/CMS-Development/adding-loop-index-to-variable-name/td-p/298526?profile.language=es>
If it is indeed the author profile language it would explain why I get random languages on different visits

You can fetch form submission using API,
then show that in desired format in “thank you” page
Let me take a look! Thanks for helping, will report back shortly :saluting_face:
Hi team! I've been chatting with HubSpot support about a question I have and was directed to join this Slack group. Which channel is best to post my question? Thank you!
Hi Rachel, take a look at the different channel options. If your question seems relevant to one of those categories you can throw it in there or feel free to post your question here.
Thanks <@U078C8MQX2R> - it's about adding video to our custom email template. Maybe 'email-development'?
<@U07HHJ1LS78> I think that's a good bet!
Great, thanks!

Hi everyone! As many others, I was sent here by HubSpot support :slightly_smiling_face: We are encountering issues with some custom code steps in workflows that were working fine before. Specifically 1 step in all our similar workflows gets an error since August 12 or 13. Anybody has had an issue with workflows using custom code since that date?
Could you share your error? :slightly_smiling_face:
Hi <@U014A8JD9DH> Sure :slightly_smiling_face:

```2024-08-21T06:52:50.616Z	ERROR	Failure : Not able to create association between deal 16355799508 and contact 31065190644
2024-08-21T06:52:50.673Z	ERROR	Unhandled Promise Rejection 	{"errorType":"Runtime.UnhandledPromiseRejection","errorMessage":"Error: One or more associations are invalid","reason":{"errorType":"Error","errorMessage":"One or more associations are invalid","stack":["Error: One or more associations are invalid","    at /var/task/file.js:48:13","    at async processEvent (/var/task/file.js:99:3)"]},"promise":{},"stack":["Runtime.UnhandledPromiseRejection: Error: One or more associations are invalid","    at process.<anonymous> (file:///var/runtime/index.mjs:1276:17)","    at process.emit (node:events:513:28)","    at emit (node:internal/process/promises:140:20)","    at processPromiseRejections (node:internal/process/promises:274:27)","    at processTicksAndRejections (node:internal/process/task_queues:97:32)"]}
Unknown application error occurred
Runtime.Unknown

Memory: 110/128 MB
Runtime: 1018.16 ms```

The previous custom code step basically creates a deal and associates it with the lead. We have no error on that step, but the deal and contact are actually not associated - hence the error on the next step

Shared with the team! It's a known issue, but not consistently reproducible. Alas, I probably won't hear much on this until September, but I'll keep you posted as soon as we hear more! Your theory is a very intriguing one <@U03MU3H35R6> - I'll be sure the team takes a closer look at it!

Hi everyone. I don’t remember if it has always been like that, but when scheduling a meeting and trying to reschedule it through the link sent in the confirmation email, we find ourselves with the form which cannot be compiled. Is it normal? is there a way to show the info on the form? or to remove those boxes?

Hey <@UNWHHSWHJ>! Moving forward can you ensure any posts like this are shared in <#C0121KGC6RM|showcase>? It would also be great if you could share what this point has to do with HubSpot development before you request folks interact with it. Thanks!
Sure, will do from next time :)
